sentence.Network_cn: 一连串不幸的事发生了.

sentence.Network_en: I lost your file by pure mischance.
sentence.Network_cn: 我把你的文件丢了,纯粹是碰上倒霉事了.

sentence.Network_en: It's an infernal mischance; I've done my best to discourage it.
sentence.Network_cn: 这真是倒楣透顶的事; 我尽量地泼冷水.

list.abs: Gratiano mischance ; the cry is very direful ., 葛莱西安诺出了什麽乱子啦 ? 这叫声很是凄惨.
By mischance I dialed a wrong number ., 很倒霉 , 我拨错了电话号码.
牛津大学英语词典 ... bad luck 不幸; 坏运气: a series of mischances 一连串的不幸 *.

from this mischance , I impressively learn that sometimes our human life is so frail , so much so that we can lose control of it before we realize what has stolen it .从这次事故中，我深刻的体会到有时人类的生命太脆弱了，以至于在我们还没意识到是什么把她夺去了时我们就已经失去了她。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French mescheance, from the verb mescheoir, from mes- 'adversely' + cheoir 'befall'

means.word_mean: 1. an unpredictable outcome that is unfortunate;

sentences.sentence: "if I didn't have bad luck I wouldn't have any luck at all"
